page.title: 20Postscript
page.content: Maghull and Lydiate exist as two separate communities joined by two main communication routes,the A59 road wich physically splits the communities in half and the Leeds_Liverpool canal which played a large part in the earlier development of the communities.Both are thriving areas and Maghull with its modern Town Square and newly opened Town Hall has a particular sense of identity. Modern housing estates combine with inter war houses and cottages and farm buildings some of which date back to the 16th century.Shops and other facilities are plentiful,there thriving youth clubs and a well appointed library and health centre.The young complain there is not enough to do and vandalism is not unknown but,compared to many parts of Merseyside,it is a pleasant area.
